feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 12 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 10 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Client requires an automated salary calculation system based on 26 working days per month, with dynamic adjustments for extra or fewer worked days
findings.issue_explanation: Current payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days, requiring manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days
findings.gap_statement: Missing automated, attendance-driven salary calculation that supports automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation formula in leave policy is overridden by payroll settings, causing user confusion about formula precedence.
findings.issue_explanation: The system allows payroll settings to supersede leave policy daily wage formulas, with greyed-out formulas indicating an intentional override for unpaid leave calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot directly synchronize or edit daily wage formulas between leave policy and payroll modules.
findings.gap_statement: No mechanism exists for automatic formula alignment between leave policy and payroll configuration.

findings.group_description: System fails to automatically update unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation
findings.issue_explanation: Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot dynamically recalculate pending leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request submission
findings.gap_statement: Lacks automatic synchronization between salary configuration changes and pending leave deduction calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap year day count, leading to potential underpayment of employee benefits
findings.issue_explanation: The system is not correctly accounting for 366 days in leap years (specifically 2024), instead defaulting to 365 days, which results in an inaccurate service period calculation and reduced gratuity amount
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage and gratuity calculation logic fails to dynamically adjust for leap years in service period computations
findings.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator lacks the ability to automatically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation shows consistent decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating daily wage for pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently produces amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points, affecting all employees regardless of departure date
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation (basic + allowances / 30) produces systematically slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision limitations
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations

findings.group_description: System's gratuity calculation has potential inconsistency in handling leap year days and service duration calculation
findings.issue_explanation: Client noticed a minor discrepancy in gratuity amount calculation, specifically around February 29th and how departure dates are included in total service days
findings.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not transparently handle leap year day inclusion and departure date counting methodology
findings.gap_statement: Need for clear, user-facing explanation of gratuity calculation methodology, including how leap years, departure dates, and service duration are computed

findings.group_description: System uses a fixed daily wage calculation method that cannot be customized, causing potential misalignment with client-specific calculation preferences.
findings.issue_explanation: The platform calculates daily wage using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from some clients' preferred method of (Basic Salary × 12 / 365).
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation method is fixed and cannot be configured or modified to accommodate different organizational calculation preferences.
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks flexibility in gratuity and daily wage calculation methodologies.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration, causing calculation discrepancies.
findings.issue_explanation: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage formulas with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), leading to inconsistent calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator uses a non-standard divisor (30.42 days) for unpaid leave deductions, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), which can result in deduction amounts that exceed the expected monthly salary.
findings.limitation_statement: The system does not cap deductions at the monthly salary amount and uses a custom divisor that may not align with user expectations.
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for how daily wage divisor is calculated and applied to leave deductions.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculator displays incorrect number of days in remarks section, despite accurate backend calculation
findings.issue_explanation: For February, the system shows a daily rate based on 31 days (925.81) in remarks, when it should reflect 29 days (989.66), even though the actual deduction calculation is mathematically correct
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot dynamically adjust remarks to show the correct number of calendar days for each month
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days

findings.group_description: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, causing potential salary deduction discrepancies
findings.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings, potentially leading to incorrect unpaid leave deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks transparency in configuration hierarchy and user controls for leave deduction calculations

findings.group_description: System displays daily rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
findings.issue_explanation: The daily rate displayed does not match the month when leave was actually taken, showing rates from the payroll month instead of the leave occurrence month
findings.limitation_statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month rather than storing the original leave occurrence month rate
findings.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

troubleshooting.group_description: Current method for handling variations in working days requires manual intervention
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting.group_description: When configuring unpaid leave daily wage calculations, users must verify payroll settings as they take precedence over leave policy formulas.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check daily wage calculator in payroll settings to confirm the actual formula being applied for unpaid leave deductions.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual method to resolve incorrect unpaid leave deduction calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and create it again if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually verify gratuity calculations for employees with service periods spanning leap years
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Confirm total service days by manually counting 366 days for 2024, and cross-reference calculated gratuity amount with MOHRE guidelines

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual steps to verify gratuity calculation when system result seems inconsistent
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate total service days, including leap year days, and verify the calculation by dividing total days by 365 to determine service years

troubleshooting.group_description: When the platform's daily wage calculation differs from client expectations, manual recalculation may be necessary.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify gratuity calculations by applying the client's preferred daily wage formula: (Basic Salary × 12 / 365) instead of the platform's (Basic Salary / 30).

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually configure leave salary and salary proration daily wage formulas to ensure consistent calculations.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and align the divisor used in both leave salary and salary proration configurations to match client expectations.

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around unpaid leave deduction calculations that may exceed monthly salary
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: To calculate unpaid leave deduction, divide monthly salary by 30.42 (custom days), then multiply by number of leave days

troubleshooting.group_description: Verify daily rate calculation by manually checking daily wage divided by actual calendar days
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check system-wide global daily rate settings that may override policy-level calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around daily rate calculation and display across different payroll months
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed which will store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount on the 'daily rate' label instead of recalculating it every time

glossary.definition: Standard calculation of 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months
A system configuration area in payroll settings that determines how daily wage is calculated, particularly for unpaid leave scenarios.
A formula display state in leave policy indicating that the current configuration is being overridden by payroll settings and cannot be directly edited.
Calculating daily wage by dividing total monthly salary by 30.41 (average days in a month)

A financial benefit calculated based on an employee's total service period, typically computed using daily wage and years of service, with specific calculation rules for different service duration brackets
A proportional salary calculation for partial periods, typically computed by dividing total salary by standard days (30) and multiplying by actual days worked
Total number of working days an employee has worked, calculated by counting days from start date to departure date, including potential special considerations like leap year days
Method of computing an employee's daily rate, which in this platform uses a fixed divisor of 30 days for basic salary, differing from some clients' preferred (Basic × 12 / 365) approach.
End of service benefit calculation that considers an employee's length of service and daily wage, with the platform using a fixed 21 days per year for service between 1-5 years.
Calculation of daily wage by dividing total monthly salary by a specific number of days (e.g., 30 or 30.42 days).
A calculation method that divides monthly salary by 30.42 days instead of calendar days when computing leave deductions
Calculation of salary reduction for days an employee is absent without pay, based on dividing monthly salary by actual calendar days in the month
A system-wide setting that determines how daily rates are calculated for unpaid leave, which can override individual policy configurations
The base salary component used in daily wage calculations, distinct from gross salary

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage remarks display
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator remarks section shows a daily rate calculation, but may not always reflect the correct number of calendar days
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Daily Wage Calculator → Unpaid Leave Deduction Section
indicators: Remarks field shows daily rate calculation
selector_hints: Remarks field shows daily rate calculation

claims_to_validate.title: gratuity calculation manual edit
claims_to_validate.statement: Users can manually edit the automatically calculated gratuity amount
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Daily Wage Calculator → Gratuity Calculation Section
expected: Gratuity amount field allows manual editing

claims_to_validate.title: global configuration precedence
claims_to_validate.statement: Global daily rate settings take precedence over policy-level leave calculation configurations
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Settings → Payroll Configuration → Global Leave Settings
steps: Check if it overrides policy-level settings
expected: Global daily rate setting is visible
Policy-level configurations cannot override global setting

claims_to_validate.title: daily rate initial storage
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is stored at the time of initial calculation and does not change when viewed in different payroll months
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Leave Deduction → Daily Rate Display
steps: Create leave request in one month
View daily rate in subsequent payroll month
expected: Daily rate matches original leave occurrence month calculation
Rate does not recalculate based on current payroll month

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage formula read only
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave policy daily wage formulas are displayed as read-only (greyed out) and cannot be directly edited by users.
expected: Formula input is disabled or read-only

claims_to_validate.title: leave encashment calculation method
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment settings include options to calculate daily wage using 'working days' or 'custom days' methods
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Daily Wage Calculator → Leave Encashment Settings
expected: Option to select 'working days' calculation method
Option to select 'custom days' calculation method

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage calculation visibility
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation fields are visible but potentially read-only

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage divisor configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage divisor is configured at policy level and cannot be overridden per employee
